title: Ended--35 raw with 7 h-o-f'ers, 4 SL's, and 3 Chases; prices added--
author: dougscats

posts.post_title: Ended--35 raw with 7 h-o-f'ers, 4 SL's, and 3 Chases; prices added--
posts.post_content:
I have a few dozen, mostly lower-grade T206's listed below that I'd like to trade, preferably, or sell.   
I am always looking to upgrade [Fair-Good or better], so if you're interested in trading please send me a list of what you have. I prefer ungraded cards.   

Post here or email [url]djdoremus@msn.com[/url]. First to say, "I'll take it," gets it.
Add $2 S/H for first card, second free; S/H free if you buy three or more.  
Most forms of payment okay.  If paypal, pay as friend, no fee; thanks.

No pm's, please.  
  
Page 1: 

KELLEY, $50,
CRAWFORD, $65,
WILLIS batting, $50,
WILLIS pitching, $45,
Chase, fielding, dark hat, Sovereign [a bit of wet-sheet transfer on back.  Small mark on bottom border], 
Chase, holding trophy [This was graded "NM-Mint/8" by PRO; it's beautiful but I take it to be trimmed], $66,
KEELER portrait, $65--SOLD--
DUFFY, $37,
WALLACE, $35--TRADED--
SL'ers:
Cranston, Memphis, $35, 
Smith, Shreveport--TRADED--
Sid Smith, Atlanta [appears to be VG or better, but trimmed], $50,
Howard, Savannah. $30,

Page 2, 11 Commons, from Fair to VG: [$155 for nine remaining]

Stahl, $20,
Dorner, $20,
Fletcher, $21,
Tannehill in wind-up [small "185" written on reverse, lower right-hand corner]--SOLD--
Clark, Columbus, $21--TRADED--
Sweeney, $20,
Raymond--SOLD--
Bliss, $15 [has hardly visible pencil erasure on back],
Fiene [name on top and bottom], $18--TRADED--
Murray, $15,
Maloney, $17,
Anderson, $15
Goode, $17.

Page 3 [in Poor-Fair range, many with good fronts, bad backs]:

Shipke [chipped corner, otherwise pretty nice], $15,
Leach]--SOLD--
White, Chicago, Sovereign--SOLD--
Stephens, $15,

Dunn [note unobvious spot of paper-loss on bottom of Dunn's sweater],
Manning [nice-looking, but i'd say trimmed and a bit thin in right-hand corner],--These 2 for $25--

Pfeister,
Egan,
Purtell, --These three [no creases that I see] for $45--
 
Chase, dark hat, throwing [back has a bit of wet-sheet transfer], $25,
Chase, blue portrait--TRADED--

Barry,
Pickering [both of these are glossy, nice looking cards, but trimmed]. 

Helm, SL, $21--SOLD--


*Note: In all scans, backs are a mirror-image/in opposite order.  Also, the cards are in two protective plastics, a halved penny-sleeve--which creates the appearance of a vertical line on each card--and a pocket-page:

For reference, already SOLD/TRADED on this thread:

Cicotte, $53--SOLD--
Elberfield fielding, AB, $25--SOLD--

page of 15 beaters for $170, delivered:--SOLD--
Chance, red portrait [obviously missing chunk of card],
Schaefer throwing,
Bridwell, cap on,
Mullin batting,
Lake, StL, throwing,
Wiltse throwing,
Moriarty fielding,
Doolan fielding,
Bradley batting,
Bergen catching,
Kruger [pin-hole at top],
White,
Konetchy fielding,
Cravath ["LF" erased on upper right],
Doyle, portrait,
I think you forgot the pics doug :)

Thanks Sean--I did attach them originally, but for some reason they didn't go through.

New scans to come.

Unable to send PM because your mailbox is full.  If selling individually, can I please have a price on the Bliss, and Doyle portrait?  Thanks my friend.

Brendan

I know I got to these late but would be very interested in what ever is left.

Thanks,
Jeff

Thanks, Ben.

JOE KELLY, SAM CRAWFORD, throwing, 2 VIC WILLIS, throwing, batting, 2 Chase, dark hat throwing, with trophy, SL'ers Cranston and Howard, Murray, Stahl, Raymond.
